title: Opossum output schema
description: Output files mainly consist of selected attribution information for parts of the input file tree and metadata.

projectId.description: An ID for the compliance scan, copied from the input file.

packageName.description: Name of the package (part of a package URL)

packageVersion.description: Version of the package (part of a package URL)

packageNamespace.description: Namespace of the pacakge, e.g. Github user (part of a package URL)

packageType.description: Protocol of the package, e.g. npm, maven (part of a package URL)

packagePURLAppendix.description: Qualifiers and subpaths of a package URL

url.description: URL for the source website of the package

licenseName.description: Name of the license, ideally SPDX identifier but can also contain arbitrary names

attributionConfidence.description: How much the information is trusted (0: bad, 100: good)

comment.description: Additional human-readable comments about the attribution that don't fit into other fields

firstParty.description: Indicates that something is first-party code.

preSelected.description: Indicates that an attribution was pre-selected from the input file.

excludeFromNotice.description: Indicates that an attribution should not be included in a notice file.

followUp.description: Indicates that an attribution is problematic and needs to be followed up.

originId.description: Can be set to track a signal from the tooling that generated the input file. Copied from the input file

resourcesToAttributions.description: Map from a path in the resource tree (e.g. `/folder/subfolder/`, `/folder/file`, note the mandatory slashes at the beginning and end) to a list of attribution IDs.

resolvedExternalAttributions.description: List of attribution IDs for input signals that are resolved.
